summary: POC-IT (Point of Care Information Technology) is a solution to both the risks of self wound treatment and the stress placed on the healthcare industry due to infections and complications caused by improper home care. It allows users to get easy to follow instructions and information on their healthcare needs from their computer or mobile device, making use of machine learning to provide hand gesture control to allow users to maintain a clean environment while performing procedures. Used React and React-Bootstrap for front-end.
title: POC-IT

summary: React-based Google Books search app that displays books based on user searches, and saves books users favorite to review or purchase later. Used MERN Stack.
title: Google Library

summary: 31% of the food produced in America is wasted at the consumer and retail level. Our Same Kitchen is a web and mobile application that bridges the gap between those in need and food establishments with surplus. It allows food establishments to easily add and notify our team of surplus food, and when and where to pick it up. Used HTML, CSS, Javascript/ES6, Nodejs, Express-Handlebars, Passport, and Sequelize.
title: Our Same Kitchen

summary: MentalNote is an application that helps you declutter your thoughts. It is a clean application that will let you create and save notes, view your old ones, and let you delete any you no longer need. Used HTML5, CSS, Javascript/ES6, Node and Express.
title: Mental Note

summary: Budget Buddy is a progressive web application that allows users to add deposits and expenses. It is ideal for travelers who like to track their budget at any time, functional offline and online.
title: Budget Buddy

summary: My first project. A kid-friendly web application that allows kids to check if a food item is safe for their allergies before consumption and suggests alternatives if not. Popular food allergy apps are catered to the adult population although food allergies are more prevalent in kids. This was the unmet need that inspired this project. Features Bulma as the front-end CSS framework, Edamam food database API and jQuery.
title: Can I Eat It
